test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS accurately monitors temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with ±0.5°C accuracy.

test_steps.action: Set up temperature sources at -80°C, 0°C, +25°C, and +50°C.
test_steps.expected_result: Temperature sources are stable and verified with reference thermometer.

test_steps.action: Expose EMS sensors to each temperature source for 15 minutes.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS displays temperature readings within ±0.5°C of reference values.

acceptance_criteria: All temperature readings are within ±0.5°C of reference values
System records readings at ≤5 minute intervals
regulatory_basis: 21 CFR Part 11 compliance for data accuracy
data_integrity_requirements: All temperature data must be stored in vendor database

test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from setpoint within required response time.

test_steps.action: Set temperature setpoint to +5°C in EMS configuration.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts and saves setpoint configuration.

test_steps.action: Gradually increase test chamber temperature to +7.1°C.
test_steps.expected_result: EMS generates audible/visual alarm within 30 seconds of reaching +7.0°C.

test_steps.action: Verify alarm notification appears in facility paging system.
test_steps.expected_result: Alarm notification received by paging system within 30 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: Alarms trigger within ±2°C deviation from setpoint
System response time ≤30 seconds for alarm conditions
Alarm notifications successfully integrate with paging system
data_integrity_requirements: All alarm events recorded in audit trail

test_cases.objective: Verify that the system accurately monitors temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with an accuracy of ±0.5°C.
prerequisites: System is installed and powered on

test_steps.action: Set the temperature reference device to -80°C and place it in the monitored area.
test_steps.expected_result: System displays temperature within -80.5°C to -79.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature reference device to +50°C and place it in the monitored area.
test_steps.expected_result: System displays temperature within +49.5°C to +50.5°C.

acceptance_criteria: All temperature readings must be within ±0.5°C of the reference device
regulatory_basis: 21 CFR Part 11 compliance for accurate data recording
data_integrity_requirements: Data must be stored in vendor's standard database format

test_cases.objective: Verify that alarm notifications are correctly integrated with the site paging system using the vendor API.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation of +3°C from setpoint in the EMS.
test_steps.expected_result: Alarm notification is triggered within 30 seconds.

test_steps.action: Verify the alarm notification appears on the site paging system.
test_steps.expected_result: Paging system displays correct alarm message within 30 seconds of trigger.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notifications must be received by paging system within 30 seconds
Message content must match the EMS alarm details
regulatory_basis: GMP requirements for timely alarm notification
data_integrity_requirements: Alarm events must be recorded in audit trail

test_cases.objective: Verify that the EMS accurately monitors temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with an accuracy of ±0.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature sensor to -80°C and record the reading.
test_steps.expected_result: The EMS displays a temperature reading within ±0.5°C of -80°C.

test_steps.action: Set the temperature sensor to +50°C and record the reading.
test_steps.expected_result: The EMS displays a temperature reading within ±0.5°C of +50°C.

acceptance_criteria: All temperature readings must be within ±0.5°C of the setpoint.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature readings are accurately recorded and stored.

test_cases.objective: Verify that alarm notifications from the EMS integrate correctly with the site paging system using the vendor API.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation of ±2°C from the setpoint.
test_steps.expected_result: The EMS generates an alarm and sends a notification to the site paging system.

test_steps.action: Verify the notification received on the site paging system.
test_steps.expected_result: The site paging system correctly displays the alarm notification.

acceptance_criteria: All alarm notifications must be correctly received and displayed by the site paging system.
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alarm notifications are accurately recorded and transmitted.

test_cases.objective: To verify that the Environmental Monitoring System accurately measures temperature within the specified range of -80°C to +50°C with an accuracy of ±0.5°C.

test_steps.action: Set the reference thermometer to a known temperature within the specified range.
test_steps.expected_result: The reference thermometer displays the set temperature accurately.

test_steps.action: Compare the EMS temperature reading with the reference thermometer reading.
test_steps.expected_result: The EMS temperature reading should be within ±0.5°C of the reference thermometer reading.

acceptance_criteria: EMS temperature readings are within ±0.5°C of the reference thermometer readings
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all temperature readings are accurately recorded and stored

test_cases.objective: To verify that the EMS integrates with the site paging system and correctly sends alarm notifications when temperature deviations occur.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature deviation of ±2°C from the setpoint in the EMS.
test_steps.expected_result: The EMS generates an alarm condition.

test_steps.action: Check the site paging system for the alarm notification.
test_steps.expected_result: The site paging system receives and displays the alarm notification.

acceptance_criteria: Alarm notifications are correctly sent to the site paging system
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alarm notifications are accurately recorded

test_cases.test_name: Temperature Alert Generation and Notification Test
test_cases.objective: Verify that the system generates alerts when temperature deviates ±2°C from the setpoint and integrates with the paging system.
prerequisites: Paging system is configured and online

test_steps.action: Set the temperature setpoint to 25°C in the EMS configuration.
test_steps.expected_result: System accepts the setpoint and displays it correctly.

test_steps.action: Simulate a temperature reading of 27.5°C (exceeding +2°C deviation).
test_steps.expected_result: System generates an alert within 30 seconds.

test_steps.action: Verify the alert is received by the paging system via the vendor API.
test_steps.expected_result: Paging system displays the alert notification.

acceptance_criteria: Alerts are generated within 30 seconds of deviation
Alerts are correctly transmitted to the paging system
Alert content matches the expected format

test_cases.test_name: Data Retention and Archival Verification Test
test_cases.objective: Confirm the system properly archives data for the required 7-year retention period using vendor features.
prerequisites: System has been operational for at least 1 month

test_steps.action: Identify sample data records older than 30 days in the primary database.
test_steps.expected_result: System displays historical records as expected.

test_steps.action: Execute the vendor's archival process for records older than 30 days.
test_steps.expected_result: Process completes without errors and provides confirmation.

test_steps.action: Verify archived data is accessible through the vendor's retrieval interface.
test_steps.expected_result: All archived records can be retrieved with complete metadata.

acceptance_criteria: Retrieved data matches source records exactly
regulatory_basis: EU GMP Annex 11 for data integrity
data_integrity_requirements: Chain of custody must be maintained
